Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Detergent \De*ter"gent\, a. [L. detergens, -entis, p. pr. of detergere: cf. F. d['e]tergent.] Cleansing; purging. -- n. A substance which cleanses the skin, as water or soap; a medicine to cleanse wounds, ulcers, etc. [1913 Webster]

detergent adj : having cleansing power [syn: {detersive}] n 1: a surface-active chemical widely used in industry and laundering 2: a cleansing agent that differs from soap but can also emulsify oils and hold dirt in suspension
